We are slowly beginning to move towards a consulting agency for CCM launches (on top of everything else)

BASEDD House will be the most trusted brand in CCM in 6 months because we run a clean shop. 

soooo many LA manager scammers are flooding the space rn and they are trying to get web2 creators to launch on pumpfun, claiming they know what they are doing when really, they are setting up these creators for failure by sniping the token, bundling the launch, etc.

Here are some quick tips to launching a creator coin:

1) DON'T TELL ANYONE WHEN YOU ARE LAUNCHING. STEALTH LAUNCH ON YOUR FNF TOO.

2) DON'T SHARE THE DEV WALLET ADDRESS PRIOR TO LAUNCH.

3) DON'T BUNDLE AND BUY YOUR SUPPLY IN PUBLIC. TRUST IS EVERYTHING.

4) YOU DON'T NEED A DEV TO LAUNCH ON PUMP

5) AS A CREATOR, YOU SHOULD OWN THE DEV WALLET AND THE SUPPLY, NOT YOUR MANAGER

6) ALWAYS CONSULT MORE THAN ONE PERSON ABOUT THE LAUNCH, ESPECIALLY SOMEONE THAT DOESN'T HAVE SKIN IN THE GAME

7) YOU DON'T NEED TO LOCK SUPPLY. TRUST IS EARNED OVER TIME AND LOCKING YOUR TOKENS DOESN'T TRULY BUILD THAT. 

If you need help, my DMs are ALWAYS open

tweets.author: a1lon9

tweets.content:
Creator coins are similar to any other subgenre of memecoin in the sense that 99% will fail. The majority of creators and CTOs will start something (often out of excitement and good intentions!) and then abandon it after a few days/weeks/months.

This is not unique to creator coins and it's not even unique to the crypto space. There are many people who aspire to be successful artists, streamers, youtubers, tiktokers, instagram influencers, podcasters, etsy shop owners, etc. But most give up after the first few set backs. It's not easy to be a creator 24/7.

As a trader, it's your job to look for creators who have a good reputation, work ethic, consistency, and experience. They should have at least some understanding of how to move in the crypto space (or at least have advisors helping them navigate the very specific demands). 

Again, this isn't unique to creator coins or artcoins or streamer coins. You should have the same mindset when looking for any type of conviction play, whether its a content creator, a CTO, or whoever.

tweets.author: a1lon9

tweets.content:
if you know someone that wants to stream on pump fun, it's your duty to the trenches to guide them the right way

that way we avoid horror stories and maximise the odds of SUCCESS stories. better for you, better for them, better for the entire space

make sure they

- get enough supply for the long-term and commit to holding the token for at least a few months
- be completely transparent about their plans for the future. no overpromising!
- commit to gaining the trust of the community. don't mess with people's money and play by the rules
- keep their plans to launch a coin lowkey. if many people know about the launch in advance, it leaves room for sniping which could ruin the coin performance and hurt early traders
- ideally have a streaming schedule thought out in advance. Consistency matters

if they're a large creator and require further support, feel free to reach out to me or anyone else with a pump fun affiliate badge. we're overrun with requests at the moment so we will try to assist as many cases as we can!

tweets.content:
my base case thesis for tokenization:

>> everyone will have a coin
>> won't be taboo (same as signing up for IG/tiktok)
>> aligned fees will get rid of creators outright scamming
>> you won't need token utility for these
>> coins will be used to bet on reputation/influence

it is very, very difficult (borderline impossible) to create an index/oracle to track someone's influence across all channels effectively.

the best way to do this is with an open market.

tweets.author: a1lon9

tweets.content:
When a serial deployer tokenized my Trencher art in April, it genuinely changed the course of my life.
 
Creator fees did not exist at that time, so when I chose to embrace the token and the community that had formed around my art, it was simply out of gratitude for the opportunity to be seen, and out of excitement to continue drawing the Trencher character. I had no clue the character would end up resonating with so many people.
 
This entire experience was so unexpected. With lots of improvisation. And I had no idea that the decisions Iâ€™ve made along the way would have a ripple effect that led to me receiving a PumpFun partnership and support from the entire Pumpfun ecosystem.
 
The PumpFun team has been so supportive from Day 1. Itâ€™s obvious they genuinely care about creators succeeding on their platform. My early conversations with Alon are a big reason why I chose to embrace the Trencher token. I have full trust in him and their whole team.
 
And now, with their new dynamic creator fee system on the table, this changes the game for artists and all mediums of creators. 
 
Genuinely, stop for a moment and contemplate what a creator coin avant-garde movement means for artists. This gives artists so much autonomy and makes it easier than ever for us to support ourselves, pay our rent, and focus on what we love... creating.
 
We are so lucky to be here, lending our voices and skills to an evolving system of what will eventually be considered to be the future best practices of our industry.
tweets.author: a1lon9

tweets.content:
We are proud to announce that we have acquired the IP rights to the Trollface meme, one of the most important memes in history. This not only makes us the official Troll token, but it makes owning $TROLL, literally owning a piece of internet history. 

The IP rights also allow us to expand the Troll brand further, to capture new audiences via new initiatives, and therefore help with our mission of reaching mass adoption. Lot more to come, stay tuned!

The creator economy has long run on a model where views drive ad revenue.

Chasing views forces creators onto a treadmillâ€¦ churning out endless content, dumbing it down, and chasing algorithms.

And they still donâ€™t own their audience.

The way forward is to monetise depth, not just reach. Building deeper connections with your community should be a real alternative â€” @pumpdotfunâ€™s latest product improvements make this possible.

tweets.content:
TLDR: The game will CHANGE FOREVER

There has been a huge problem since day 1 with CTOs. How can people stay motivated to grind without having to worry about getting the necessary funding for listings? Funding for content? 

Take this as an example: you have @grizzle_art grinding for a CTO of her own art since day one.

If she had collected the fees since day 1 or 2 of the CTO, she would have earned $1 Million, which she could have used for expenses, or even to get listings

@rasmr_eth is literally out there in the road every single day streaming, imagine earning $100k in such a short amount of time

What's also important here, is that these fees DO NOT hurt whales, it's a tiered system -> making it easier for whales to size in higher market caps

This is probably the most bullish release of 2025 and it's finally good to see that teams can focus on actually working on their coins

tweets.author: a1lon9

tweets.content:
If you look at streaming itâ€™s the most obvious product market fit for crypto.

Just considerâ€¦

- Itâ€™s the fastest-growing major media vertical
- Its audience is 80% Gen Z and younger millennials.
- In Q2 2024 alone, viewers watched 8.5â€¯billion hours of live-stream content

This isnâ€™t a narrative like crypto gaming, where the core demographic passionately hates blockchain. Gen Z and younger millennials are the biggest users of crypto, and both industries have an overlapping 70-80% male user base. 

Moreover, when you consider the economic reality for younger generations - stagnant wages, unaffordable housing, automation, rising costs - streaming make a lot of sense as a way to earn a living. Traditionally, whenever something moves from counterculture into 'mainstream thought', as this is trending to do so, the money printer goes brrr.

On top of that, the world is becoming more isolated/doomer pilled, which increases demand for persistent, interactive digital spaces. Streaming supplies them, and crypto turns them from places you 'just visit' into co-owned/shared virtual economies. 

We saw this concept play out, to a degree, with NFTs in 2021/22. In a post-pandemic world, digital identity and community were big movers of the industry. They didnâ€™t stick, but the psychology behind what made that movement â€˜stickyâ€™ is also what is making streaming a dominant form of new media.

Simply put, in a world that progressively becomes more unstable and unfair, people will turn inward looking for digital communities and economies - streaming provides the social layer; crypto provides the economic layer. 

This wonâ€™t happen overnight, but itâ€™s clear that the vision of @a1lon9 et al in this industry isnâ€™t larp. Thereâ€™s real demand, a real need, and clear product-market fit for this vertical. It's quite literally â€˜just getting startedâ€™ and, IMO, will become the dominant vertical in crypto outside of DeFi.
